com.googlecode.biscotti.collect

Class Iterators2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.Iterators2

  • public final class Iterators2
extends Object
    Static utility methods which operate on or return Iterators.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    Iterators

    • Method Detail

      • concat

        public static <E> ListIterator<E> concat(ListIterator<E>... inputs)
        Combines multiple list iterators into a single ListIterator. The returned list iterator supports the add(E), remove(), and set(E) operations if the corresponding backing iterator supports them.
        Parameters:
        inputs - the source list iterators
        Returns:
        a ListIterator consisting of specified list iterators

      • countIf

        public static <E> int countIf(Iterator<E> iterator,
              Predicate<? super E> predicate)
        Returns the number of elements in the given Iterator which satisfy the specified Predicate.
        Parameters:
        iterator - the given Iterator
        predicate - the specified Predicate
        Returns:
        the number of elements in iterator which satisfy predicate

      • countIfNot

        public static <E> int countIfNot(Iterator<E> iterator,
                 Predicate<? super E> predicate)
        Returns the number of elements in the given Iterator which do not satisfy the specified Predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of elements in the given Iterator
        Parameters:
        iterator - the given Iterator
        predicate - the specified Predicate
        Returns:
        the number of elements in iterator which do not satisfy predicate

      • filter

        public static <E> UnmodifiableListIterator<E> filter(ListIterator<E> unfiltered,
                                     Class<E> type)
        Decorates the given ListIterator to return only the elements that are instances of the specified Class.
        Parameters:
        unfiltered - a list iterator containing objects of any type
        type - the type of elements desired
        Returns:
        an UnmodifiableListIterator containing all elements of the original iterator that were of the requested type

      • filter

        public static <E> UnmodifiableListIterator<E> filter(ListIterator<E> unfiltered,
                                     Predicate<? super E> predicate)
        Decorates the given ListIterator to return only the elements that satisfy the specified Predicate.
        Parameters:
        unfiltered - the given list iterator
        predicate - the specified predicate
        Returns:
        an UnmodifiableListIterator which returns only the elements of unfiltered that satisfy predicate

      • emptyListIterator

        public static <E> ListIterator<E> emptyListIterator()
        Returns an immutable empty ListIterator.
        Returns:
        an immutable empty ListIterator

      • emptyPeekingIterator

        public static <E> PeekingIterator<E> emptyPeekingIterator()
        Returns an immutable empty PeekingIterator.
        Returns:
        an immutable empty PeekingIterator

      • listIterator

        public static <E> UnmodifiableListIterator<E> listIterator(Iterator<E> iterator)
        Decorates the specified Iterator to behave like a ListIterator by maintaining a List of all elements returned from calls to next().

        The remove(), set(E), and add(E) operations are not supported. Modifying the underlying Iterator yields unpredictable results.

        Parameters:
        iterator - the underlying Iterator
        Returns:
        a UnmodifiableListIterator backed by iterator

      • reverseOrder

        public static <E> Iterator<E> reverseOrder(Collection<? extends E> c)
        Returns an Iterator over the specified Collection in reverse sequential order. If the specified collection is an instance of Deque or NavigableSet the iterator is obtained by invoking the descendingIterator() method, else an unmodifiable iterator is returned by calling the reverseOrder(Iterator) method.
        Parameters:
        c - the specified collection
        Returns:
        an iterator over the specified collection in reverse sequential order

      • reverseOrder

        public static <E> UnmodifiableIterator<E> reverseOrder(Iterator<? extends E> iterator)
        Returns an UnmodifiableIterator which reverses the iteration order of the specified Iterator. The underlying iterator must be non-blocking and finite, because it is necessary to iterate through all its elements on startup.
        Parameters:
        iterator - the underlying Iterator
        Returns:
        a reverse view of iterator

      • transform

        public static <E,T> ListIterator<T> transform(ListIterator<E> fromIterator,
                              Function<? super E,? extends T> function)
        Returns a ListIterator that applies the specified Function to each element of the given list iterator.

        The returned list iterator does not support add(E) and set(E) but does support remove() if the given list iterator does.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of elements traversed by the given list iterator
        T - the type of output of the specified function
        Parameters:
        fromIterator - the given list iterator
        function - the specified function
        Returns:
        a list iterator that applies function to each element of fromIterator

      • unmodifiable

        public static <E> UnmodifiableListIterator<E> unmodifiable(ListIterator<? extends E> listIterator)
        Decorates the specified ListIterator to prevent remove(), add(E), and set(E).
        Parameters:
        listIterator - the underlying ListIterator
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of listIterator

      • unmodifiable

        public static <E> UnmodifiablePeekingIterator<E> unmodifiable(PeekingIterator<? extends E> peekingIterator)
        Decorates the specified PeekingIterator to prevent remove().
        Parameters:
        peekingIterator - the underlying PeekingIterator
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of peekingIterator
